  4557. I also have been on prescription acne medication and have not had to use it nearly as much since starting this product and have not used my prescription in two weeks with absolutely no break-outs.
  4558. In the last 10 years or so my dad has also been told frequently that he looks younger than he is.
  4559. I have been experimenting with various natural products for skin care, with mixed results.
  4560. -- it has a thin, slippery quality that seems to be absorbed very well, and doesn't leave any sticky residue on the face.
  4561. Also my left eyelid creased differently than my right, making it appear smaller than the other
  4562. my pores have not tightened at least enough to notice and comment positively (then again what would be considered reasonable results where tightening pores are concerned?)
  4563. because I use every time when I wash my face, that work for my very sensitive and Dry skin
  4564. Finally, I came across the TruSkin products and read reviews and decided to try it, not expecting much due to my experiences with so many products in the past.
  4565. I have tried many other serums that do nothing for your skin, some of them pretty expensive as Lancome Genifique.
  4566. Give this serum a try if your looking for something to smooth out the fine lines and restore some brightness to a tired, dull complexion.
  4567. I have spent tons of money on high end products.
  4568. So super soft and moist without being oily, less dark pigmentation and lines are lessening already.
  4569. Since I've used barely a dropper per application, it had to mean the bottle wasn't full when I received it but that I didn't notice until today.
  4570. and I don’t want to use a heavy facial lotion, the serum is all I am using right now in the morning. 
  4571. It also appears a little more firm and I have only used it about 5 times.
  4572. I like that it has very little odor and is quickly absorbed into your skin.
  4573. My counter is full of bottles of products (waste of money) and they would either irritate my skin or make me look greasy or dry it out.
  4574. The serum is really working well to fade my dark spots,
  4575. and I have dark circles under my eyes from not sleeping as much as I should.
  4576. It Didn't really do anything for my dark spots after using it for a couple of month
  4577. Besides the lightening of my dark spots, this serum also makes the skin on my face and chest much softer and decreases pore size.
  4578. However, it is too early to tell how well it is going to work long term.
  4579. but apparently I use too much as I am low on stock.
  4580. even though it has been a short period of time so far) has definitely left my skin feeling softer and smoother, especially when I wake up in the morning.
  4581. There is no strange scent, no greasy feel, nothing about it
  4582. I haven't felt my skin this soft in a long time...
  4583. There is absolutely NO greasy, icky, texture to this product, as found in most facial serums.
  4584. my smile lines and small lines in my forehead have all but disappeared.
  4585. I've been using this product consistently as directed 2x a day since I received it- a few weeks ago now.
  4586. I plan on using this product for at least 6 months to see the full results.
  4587. I will be ordering more today because when I was putting it on my face last night I dropped it in the sink full of water from washing my face :(
  4588. I had a large squamous cell carcinoma removed from my nose a year and a half ago
  4589. I have very dry, very sensitive skin.
  4590. I have noticed a smoother brighter complexion and imperfections such as large pores and dark sun spots are minimizing.
  4591. and I have very sensitive skin that can easily breakout with the wrong product.
  4592. Most recently I was recommended an extremely expensive Italian product that is supposed to help sensitive skin.
  4593. I've had problems with pre-cancer on my face for years and have tried numerous creams and treatments with very little success....

  4597. and I tend to be sensitive and dry.
  4598. I have dry, sensitive skin which is a hassle to deal with living in the desert.
  4599. I'm a 25 year old with dry skin.
  4600. My skin has been much smoother and less acne prone since I started using it.
  4601. All the previous vitamin C serums I had tried really irritated me skin.
  4602. I use Perricone products generally so this is an extra step that I have incorporated prior to using moisturizer.
  4603. My smiling lines, dark circles, pimples, dark spots, dry spots have pretty much disappeared in about 3 months of use.
  4604. After using it for first few days, my skin looked smoother, and it wasn't only me who noticed it.
  4605. I have a fairly large dark spot that is almost not visible even without make up in only a couple of weeks of twice daily use.
  4606. I think it's slowly helping with my dark spots and preventing Melasma; and it is about the only safe treatment I can use during pregnancy.
  4607. I have found that I have a much healthier, firmer, and less lined facial and neck appearance since using this serum.
  4608. Over several months, applied once a day, the serum has lightened the spot so that it is smoother, much lighter, and less noticeable.
  4609. I can see so much difference in my skin already and it doesn't have that tight feel to it now, nor does it have flakiness.

  4619. I look fabulous everyday!!!
  4620. I apply it first in my regimen day and night and a little goes a long way.

  142. I was given this by a blogger friend to test and give a review for her blog. (BTW - great way to try out new products without having to buy them!) Hyaluronic Acid will plump up the top layers of your skin for immediate results, but know that it does not make a long term difference - you have to keep using it to get those results. Vitamin C is a little different, it is a building block for healthy skin and connective tissue and it will help in the longer term. HOWEVER. No matter what any company says, Vitamin C is not stable and it should be refrigerated. So many companies making these products say to store at room temperature, but not true. Keep it in the fridge, you will get better results. The jury is out as to how well topical Vitamin C is absorbed by the skin, but if you get nice results (I did!) then the skin can absorb at least enough to make a difference. Tips: More is not necessarily better. I tried it two ways - putting a lot on in the morning, once a day, and then less morning and night, twice a day. The twice a day did better, and the once a day using a lot left my skin a tad sticky. My recommendation is apply a few drops at a time until you cover face, neck, etc. that you want to treat. Another tip: I also use it on my hands. I am starting to get discoloration spots on my hands, and this has helped lessen them. When I test products for my blogger friend, I first try the product all by itself to see what results it gives alone. I can say that this product gave decent results. I then use products with my regular routine and see how it works together. That's when I saw amazing results. I use[[ASIN:B007VEPVZC Bel Essence - (2oz) 100% All-Natural, Organic Anti-Wrinkle Oil Treatment with Argan, Grapeseed and Avocado Oil]] daily, it's all natural and organic, vegan, etc. The Bel Essence oil has more vitamins, omega 3's and 6's, fatty acids, that are the building blocks for collagen and skin cells. When you add the Vitamin C, it's almostlike giving your skin the complete food pyramid. Results with the two products are fabulous. Within a month, my skin was smoother, firmer, skin tone was more even, dark spots lighter, and most of all my skin was hydrated and soft ALL DAY. Elbows aren't scaly and dry, the fine lines on my face are gone, the heavier lines on my forehead and on the sides of my mouth are shorter, not as deep and barely noticeable and the dark circles under my eyes are even lighter. The Bel Essence alone gave me great results, the Vitamin C Serum gave me good results, but the two together are really powerful. Note: It takes a minute for the Vitamin C to be absorbed in your skin, and the oil also takes a minute to absorb. I put the oil on first after my shower (am and pm) when my skin is warm and dry and it absorbs faster. Then I put the Vitamin C on - this order seems to take the least time to absorb. I can say though, even waiting a couple of minutes for the products to be absorbed - definitely worth it. (The Bel Essence also comes in a cream if you prefer creams). I've always been complimented about my skin - you have a nice glow! your skin is so nice! - but I've been getting more compliments since I started using both products. Highly recommend both.

But let me also mention that age is what it is, and the normal process of aging will include the effects we see on faces as they age. If you are using an SPF product, eating right, exercising, and drinking water (and not smoking, which will add years to your skin), then you are already doing a lot for your skin naturally. But, it helps to have a serum that also provides the extra nutrients that will slow the aging process and help reduce the natural appearance of aging. Having said that, let me note that I am 40 and have scar tissue on my face from cystic acne from my early 20s, and I am very specific about my skin regime. I bought this product because of the ingredients as well as the reviews, and I am happy with the results. I also love that this product is reasonably priced, is easy to apply, absorbs nicely, does not have a film or greasy feeling, and has no odor. Again, I do not expect the aging process to be reversed and I would be suspicious of any product that claims to do that, but I can say that this product (as well as the customer service) exceeds my expectations and my skin appears smoother, and feels healthier.

There is quite a lot of evidence to suggest exfoliation followed by topical Vit C is the way to go in terms of prevention and optimum maintenance of skin. I have sensitive, combination skin prone to allergic reactions, breakouts, and extreme dryness with the use of many common skincare products. I'd heard about the benefits of hyaluronic acid, particularly in combination with vitamin C, for hydration, texture, and fine lines, and at age 36, I knew I'd likely benefit from it. Because of the sensitivity of my skin, I sought out a natural product without the added chemicals which could trigger a skin reaction. Based on the product description, this serum seemed perfect.<br /><br />After a month of use, I can honestly say the texture of my skin has noticeably improved. While my skin has always been tight due to dryness, there's now an underlying suppleness, likely due to the hyaluronic acid and its ability to draw water into the cells. I've had absolutely no adverse skin reactions with this product; it absorbs quickly into the skin without any residual stickiness or fragrance, and it layers very well under my usual moisturizer without adding any bulk. I'm quite impressed with this product and will definitely reorder.

  667. This one is clear with a slight medicinal scent. I think the scent may be the witch hazel. Hyaluronic acid is known to be able to retain a significant amount of water compared to its molecule size which is supposed to help keep more moisture in and around ones skin along with helping to minimize wrinkles.<br /><br />I'm told constantly (as in several times a week) that I look significantly younger than my age. The consensus from my peers and professors (in my college courses), the high school girls I've helped coach in gymnastics, and people in general I've gotten is that I look a good 7 years younger. Not that I'm complaining or anything, I just get a bit of a kick whenever I see a surprised look on people's faces when I tell them my actual age. In the last 10 years or so my dad has also been told frequently that he looks younger than he is. It is a very good problem to have. That said, I'd like to take care of my skin to keep it looking young so I'm very interested in any anti-aging product. And as I have chronically dry skin all year round, I'm all for trying a serum that is supposed to help keep moisture in and around my skin.<br /><br />The directions for use state, &#34;Wash and pat skin dry. If using a toner, apply toner first. Apply a small amount to entire face, neck, and decollete. Allow to dry. Follow with a moisturizer.&#34; <br /><br />I've really enjoyed being able to use this serum (and ones like it) for the last 6 weeks or so. I do think I've seen an improvement in the unevenness of my skin tone. My skin is quite light, any redness or darkness (ie under the eyes)shows quite easily. Since I've been faithfully using this serum I've found my skin to have a bit less redness. I've gotten into using a lighter coverage foundation in recent months and find with less redness in my skin, I don't particularly need to use a full coverage foundation. And with the weather here in So. Cal like being on a roller coaster (about 2 weeks ago, it was 100 degrees here, then 5 days later is was 65 degrees) ride, I find medium to full coverage foundations to 'melt' off whereas the sheerer foundations stay put better.

C product because i wasn't convinced it was necessary - and I am all about trying new products recommended to me. That said - I've been doing more research on Vit. C and decided to put it back into my regimen. But here's the deal. After using TruSkin Naturals for about 5 months now - maybe 6 - and really, really loving the price - I've mostly seen a reduced appearance of pores. That's good - but I have not seen any change in lines, wrinkles, or dark spots. In fact, i have new lines, wrinkles, and dark spots since using it. This only tells me that there is no real miracle product. I've had the most anti-aging results from laser treatments in the past. I just can't afford them right now. That said, I struggle with many of the Amazon-promoted Vit. C products that are in the organic category and that are in the $20 price range - because I look at these products and they have 1600 - 2000 positive reviews - all singing the praises of the product and sounding suspiciously alike. Whereas, other more expensive, well-known products like Perricone or Skinceuticals have around 12 - 25 mixed reviews. I think this is an okay product. I like the way my skin looks immediately after I put it on my face. However, through the course of the day, my dry skin looks drier at the end of the day. And that part I don't like. Do I think it's worth the 20 bucks? Yep.

Spots and, well, things, attach to your skin. They're not of the harmful ilk, just annoying. I purchased this serum to attack a 'place' on my forehead that has been there for years. I'm not finished with the bottle, yet the bothersome spot has decreased from the size of a pencil eraser to pencil lead tip. I'm running around town (well, my living room) telling people to touch my face and feel how soft I am! No more rough thingy!<br /><br />The deets: Gently apply a few drops of serum (according to directions, read 'em!) morning and night. Experience the lovely tightening effect. Apply some moisturizer and forget anything is on your face. Eagerly await the difference.<br /><br />This serum works. I bought it because it sounded good. I'll keep buying it because it is now one of the only products I need. Trust.

  1346. This product sounded wonderful, BAD results. It was purchased in the summer months, arrived on a 100 degree day, and sat in a broiling mailbox for several hours until painfully hot to the touch. After use skin appeared red, felt slightly raw, pores appeared larger. Discontinued use after 1 week. Later read that vitamin C oxidizes over 70 degrees Farenheit, and that oxidized vitamin C can be a skin irritant. Don't know whether this was the issue or not, but nevertheless cannot give positive review. UPDATE: I was contacted by the company shortly after I posted this review, and they offered me a chance to try the product again, when the heat wave in my area had broken. I agreed and a new bottle arrived fairly promptly. I've been using it for a week now, and I've had none of the bad reactions I had last time. I can't really tell yet whether it's doing anything special for me... I think my skin tone looks a little evener, but I'm going to give it a little more time. So my review goes from one star to four, for the combination of FANTASTIC customer service and a product that's definitely much better when it isn't exposed to extreme heat.
